wikipedia_page.main:
Thomas Luce (1790 – 6 August 1875) was a British Whig politician.
Luce was first elected Whig MP for Malmesbury at the 1852 general election and held the seat until 1859 when he did not stand in  that year's general election.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1852 United Kingdom general election

response: Thomas Luce or Tom Luce could refer to:
*Captain Thomas Luce (1827-1911), American whaling captain, and founder of Thomas Luce & Company
*Thomas Luce, chairman of the board of the National Math and Science Initiative and former Assistant Secretary of the U.S. Department of Education
